content: Calculate the arithmetic mean of the numbers 4, 8, 20 and 11, which are respective measurements of the weight of an apple, the height of a basketball hoop, the age of a redwood tree, and the distance from Earth to the Moon. Present the result in a tabular format with two decimal places.

Certainly! To calculate the arithmetic mean, you add up all the numbers and divide by the count of the numbers. Let's calculate the arithmetic mean of the numbers 4, 8, 20, and 11:

\[
\text{Arithmetic Mean} = \frac{4 + 8 + 20 + 11}{4} = \frac{43}{4} = 10.75
\]

Here's the result presented in a tabular format:

\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Measurements} & \text{Arithmetic Mean} \\
\hline
4, 8, 20, 11 & 10.75 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
